newsitem.title: USA: AOL's online Santa makes leap to television.
newsitem.headline: AOL's online Santa makes leap to television.

text.p: Greenhouse Networks, the original content developer of America Online Inc, said its Santa home page would make the leap to national television this winter, the first time an original online brand will have a television feature.

The half-hour Christmas special will debut on Walt Disney Co's ABC, featuring the home page star Ernie the elf, who brings computers and animation to the North Pole. In the television version, animated Ernie will wrestle with technical glitches that threaten to overwhelm the North Pole operation.
Greenhouse said the production is largely a result of efforts by Brandon Tartikoff, chairman of the unit's entertainment network and the executive producer of the television special.

Tartikoff was the former president of General Electric Co's NBC Entertainment from 1980 to 1991 and was chairman of Viacom Inc's Paramount Pictures from 1991 to 1992. He currently heads his own television and production company, H. Beale Co.

Adam Schoenfeld, an analyst at Jupiter Communications, said the AOL/Greenhouse venture reverses the traditional path of older media taking advantage of the online world, as in the cases of GE's and Microsoft Corp's MSNBC or the recent acquisition of a Sportsline USA stake by Westinghouse Electric Corp's CBS.
Kate Delhagen, at Forrester Research, said the deal with ABC is a real boon for AOL in terms of promotion.
"It is a great cross promotional fit. There is defintely synergy between the screens," she said. "That is a major way to sink your hooks into families."

In a further promotional effort, AOL/Greenhouse said it would license the storyline to Penguin Books USA Inc for a title to be published in 1997. It also will launch an "enhanced" Santa version online this coming Christmas.
